text:
I've tryed setting this HostnameLookups to off, in global config, virtual host 
and my logs still shows that apache still trying to resolve all my visitors.
creator: apache@alexus.org
slive@apache.org
text:
Check all your Allow and Deny statements.  If they contain anything other than
an IP address or the word "all", apache will need to do a reverse lookup and the
results will be in the logs.

creator: slive@apache.org
text: *** Bug 38755 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

mine have all, but i noticed that default configuration for LogFormat had %h 
instead of %a, I'm not 100% sure if that how is it suppose to be, but once i 
changed it to %a, in my logs, I'm seeing IPs intead of hosts.

changed from:

LogFormat "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-Agent}i\"" 
combined

changed to:

LogFormat "%a %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-Agent}i\"" 
combined

my log start loging IP addresses in my log file, but i think apache still try 
to resolves all visitors

so no matter if i set HostnameLookups to on or off, it is not working, so i 
think that is a bug
creator: apache@alexus.org

text:
Look again at your Allow/Deny directives.  I have seen this issue reported about
a dozen times (on the users list, where this question belongs...) and the answer
has always been that.  Use grep to extract every instance of Allow and Deny and
verify what they say.  Check httpd.conf and all Include'd config files and
.htaccess files.
creator: slive@apache.org
apache@alexus.org
text:
d# grep Allow httpd.conf
# Listen: Allows you to bind Apache to specific IP addresses and/or
    AllowOverride All
        Allow from all
    # AllowOverride controls what directives may be placed in .htaccess files.
    AllowOverride None
    Allow from all
    # Redirect: Allows you to tell clients about documents that used to 
    AllowOverride All
    Allow from all
d# grep Deny httpd.conf
    Deny from none
    Deny from all
d# 

i don't do anything by IP, I use default configuration file, haven't changed

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #5)

>     Deny from none

That denies access to a host named "none", which requires a reverse lookup.
It is certainly not in the default config file, so you've apparently made more
changes than you remember.  (And it is not necessary to use the HostNameLookups
directive, since it defaults to Off.)

creator: apache@alexus.org

apache was deny everything so i had to put deny none, i wasn't realizing that
